thread.title: Teague leads Hawks in preseason opener
thread.title_full: Teague leads Hawks in preseason opener

author: Gary Schatz Associated Press (noreply@cherokeetribune.com)
title: Teague leads Hawks in preseason opener
text: Teague leads Hawks in preseason opener by Gary Schatz October 08, 2015 12:39 AM | 209 views | 0 | 2 | | LeBron James, center, drives to the hoop as the Hawks’ Jeff Teague reaches in during Wednesday night’s preseason opener in Cincinnati. Associated Press photo slideshow CINCINNATI — Jeff Teague scored 15 of his 17 points in the first half and the Atlanta Hawks defeated the Cleveland Cavaliers 98-96 in the preseason opener for both teams.J.R. Smith had 15 points and James Jones added 13 for the Cavaliers, who swept Atlanta in the Eastern Conference finals last season. LeBron James had eight points and seven rebounds in 22 minutes for Cleveland.Al Horford scored 15 points and Kent Bazemore had 12 for the Hawks.MISSINGCleveland played without Kyrie Irving (knee) and Kevin Love (shoulder) and Tristan Thompson is not playing while negotiating a new contract.Atlanta was missing Thabo Sefolosha, who broke his leg while being arrested by New York City police in April. Sefolosha is on trial in New York for his involvement in a fight outside a nightclub. He is expected to be ready for the season opener.RETURNINGLove has been cleared to participate in 3-on-3 drills starting Saturday. He is expected to play Monday against Memphis.UP NEXTAtlanta plays New Orleans on Friday in Jacksonville, Florida. Cleveland plays at Philadelphia tonight.
